name: road construction | road | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5630/documentation

The dataset represents the expenditures and interventions due to the provision of road, tunnel and bridge infrastructures, the renewal of different road layers and eventual road disposal. All environmental exchanges refer to one meter and year (m*a). Road provision is therefore modelled as a constant renewal rather than as a one-time expenditure and end-of-life, and is assumed directly related to gross vehicle weight (vehicle plus load). In the transport datasets the value of 5.37E-04 m*y per gross ton vehicle km should be applied. The dataset is based on a modeling of Swiss motorways and Class 1, 2 & 3 roads as described in the following sources: ;;Bundesamt für Statistik (2000) Mobilität in der Schweiz. Ergebnisse des Mikrozensus 2000 zum Verkehrsverhalten. Bundesamt für Statistik, Bern.;;Maibach et al. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. INFRAS, Zürich.;;;The operation and maintenance of roads then refers to aspects of lighting, weed control, line marking, etc. rather than the replacement and repair of road sections and is therefore directly related to km use. Operation and maintenance are not considered in this road construction dataset.

The dataset starts with land trransformation for the construction/replacement of roads. 

The dataset ends with the replacement of road, tunnel and bridge infrastructures. 

The dataset includes the land, material and energy uses and the construction processes (excavation). It also includes the NMVOC and particulate matter emissions, and the eventual disposal of the road infrastructures as a continous process of renewal.

The dataset does not include road operation and maintenance.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/421:Construction of roads and railways/4210:Construction of roads and railways

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Road lenght is based on Swiss statistical data (2000). The material consumption represents a situation in the early 1990ties.The road and embakement area are based on a study from 1995 and have been modufied with current road infrastructure data. Road lenght is based on the same statistical data (2000).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data refers to average conditions in Switzerland. For de icing activities, a recent Austrian has been applied.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In order to account for the environmental interventions due to road construction (road, tunnel and bridge) generic data for the Swiss road infrastructure is employed. The figures presented are based on inventories generated by Maibach et al. (1999). Due to the fact that different layers of a road are characterised by various life spans, the data is presented for 1 meter of road and 1 year. Different road types have been distinguished; namely motorway (Nationalstrassen) and three different classes (1st class road, 2nd class road and 3rd class road) of the Swiss Road network. For all categories, layers and materials are recorded, according to their life span. For the calculation of material expenditures per m bitumen road, recycling rates have been estimated. For the road foundation, a recycling rate of 50% has been assumed. For the surfacing and for the subgrade no recycling has been assumed. The subgrade will be removed after 100 years and the street must be completely re-constructed. For concrete roads, no recycling is as-sumed. VOC emissions in road construction originate from the use of bitumen. Significant emissions of VOC emissions result from paving works in particular from the use of bitumen solvents for road surface treatments. Bitumen emulsions are characterised by a small solvent content less than 5g/kg.  The yearly mass load in Switzerland is estimated with 3.6%. Hot spray bituminous binders contribute approximately 1.6% of the yearly bitumen consumption for road construction in Switzerland and are characterised by a fairly high solvent content: 90-140 g/kg bitumen Stolz (2001). Moreover, during thermic processes of solvent free bitumen VOC emissions occur.  These emissions significantly change with the processing temperature and the bitumen type used. In this study, we employ an emission factor of 12kg NMVOC/t bitumen available from BUWAL (1995). Data of particulate emissions from mechanical processes and activities on road construction sites are available from Stolz (2001). The size distribution has been adjusted to comply with the size distribution used in this project. ;References:;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. ;Stolz J. (2001) Luftschadstoff-Emissionen von Strassenbaustellen. Teil I: PAH und VOC. Nr. 126. Bundesamt für Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft (BUWAL), Bern;BUWAL (1995) Handbuch: Emissionsfaktoren für stationäre Quellen. Bundesamt fuer Umwelt, Wald und Landschaft, Bern;Wresowar M. and Sieghardt M. (2000) Studie über die Auswirkung stickstoffhältiger Auftaumittel. Auswirkungen auf Boden und Bewuchs. Vergleich mit herkömmlichen Auftaumitteln. pdf-file from http://www.magwien.gv.at/ma22/pool/doc/auftaumittel.pdf.;Hüsler W., Willi E., Meier E., Bachmann P. and Brodkowski L. (1989) Verkehrsflächen der Schweiz: Groberhebung. zur Raumplanung. Bundesamt für Raumplanung (BRP), Bern as pdf-File under: N;BfS (2000) Mobilität in der Schweiz. Ergebnisse des Mikrozensus 2000 zum Verkehrsverhalten. Bundesamt für Statistik, Bern;BFE (2003) Gesamte Erzeugung und Abgabe Elektrischer Enegie in der Schweiz. 1991. Bundesamt für Energie, Bern, Online-Version under: http://www.energie-schweiz.ch/.

These data has been modified according to recent changes in the Swiss Road network Bundesamt für Statistik (BfS) (2000). Maintenance and land use
